content.description:
His accensaaccendo, -ere, -i, -censum: to inflame super iactatos aequore toto 
TroasTroas = acc. pl., “Trojans”, reliquiasreliquiae, -arum, f. pl.: survivors DanaumDanaum = Danaorum atque immitisimmitis, -e, adj.: cruel AchilliAchilles, -i, m.: Achilles (Greek leader involved in the Trojan War), 
arcebatarceo, -ere: to keep away1 longe Latio, multosque per annos 
errabant, acti Fatis, maria omnia circum.
 1:The subject of arcebat is the goddess Juno.↩
content.question: The passage, from the proem of the Aeneid, is an example of which feature of the epic genre?

choices.label: The beginning of the plot in medias res
The gods personified as forces of nature
A descent into the Underworld by the hero

content.answer: The beginning of the plot in medias res

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
